Scope and Contents
This collection consists of one scrapbook of newspaper clippings pertaining to the 1960 air plane collision and subsequent crash in Park Slope. Newspapers represented in the scrapbook include the New York Post, the World-Telegram, the New York Times, the Herald-Tribune, the Daily Mirror and others. Coverage dates from December 16, 1960 through September 1963.
Biographical / Historical
On December 16, 1960, Flight paths of the two aircraft involved, a United Airlines flight bound for Idlewild Airport (now John F. Kennedy International Airport) collided with a TWA flight descending into the city's LaGuardia Airport. One plane crashed on Staten Island, the other into Park Slope at the intersection of Seventh Avenue and Sterling Place. All 128 people on both aircraft were killed and six people on the ground. The accident became known also as the Park Slope plane crash and on Staten Island, it became known as the Miller Field crash.
